grupoQuestao.enunciado_clean: 1 How can a country’s history, geography, culture,politics and religion be squeezed into the design of a flag?Wars, revolutions, political unions and public competitions4 have shaped the colours and content of these most evocative ofsymbols. In the South Pacific, New Zealand has launched acompetition to find a flag that represents both its modern,7 multicultural identity and its rich indigenous heritage.It is quite tough to represent an entire nation on apiece of cloth. The Kiwi public has until 16 July, 2015 to10 submit its ideas to an independent panel, made up of prominentNew Zealanders who will help decide what a new flag will looklike. Its task is to choose what it considers to be the best four13 entrants, which will be the subject of a referendum inNovember. There will be a second binding vote early next yearwhen the winner will go up against the current New Zealand16 flag, which features the old colonial British Union Jack on ablue background with four red stars symbolising the SouthernCross constellation.19 Thousands of submissions have been made. Each onewill be considered individually, before this long list is finallywhittled down to the final four. In New Zealand, the most22 common themes in the national flag consideration project arethe silver fern, a plant easily found in New Zealand, and thekiwi, a flightless bird with a long bill. What do our flags say about us? Internet: <www.bbc.com> (adapted). In reference to the vocabulary used in the text What do our flags say about us?, judge the next items.
grupoQuestao.enunciado:
1 How can a country’s history, geography, culture,

politics and religion be squeezed into the design of a flag?

Wars, revolutions, political unions and public competitions

4 have shaped the colours and content of these most evocative of

symbols. In the South Pacific, New Zealand has launched a

competition to find a flag that represents both its modern,

7 multicultural identity and its rich indigenous heritage.

It is quite tough to represent an entire nation on a

piece of cloth. The Kiwi public has until 16 July, 2015 to

10 submit its ideas to an independent panel, made up of prominent

New Zealanders who will help decide what a new flag will look

like. Its task is to choose what it considers to be the best four

13 entrants, which will be the subject of a referendum in

November. There will be a second binding vote early next year

when the winner will go up against the current New Zealand

16 flag, which features the old colonial British Union Jack on a

blue background with four red stars symbolising the Southern

Cross constellation.

19 Thousands of submissions have been made. Each one

will be considered individually, before this long list is finally

whittled down to the final four. In New Zealand, the most

22 common themes in the national flag consideration project are

the silver fern, a plant easily found in New Zealand, and the

kiwi, a flightless bird with a long bill.

What do our flags say about us? Internet: <www.bbc.com> (adapted).

In reference to the vocabulary used in the text What do our flags say about us?, judge the next items.

rows.enunciado: The meaning of “The Kiwi public” (l.9) can be inferred by the content of the text as being the New Zealanders.

itens.corpo_clean: Certo
Errado

grupoQuestao.enunciado_clean: 1 How can a country’s history, geography, culture,politics and religion be squeezed into the design of a flag?Wars, revolutions, political unions and public competitions4 have shaped the colours and content of these most evocative ofsymbols. In the South Pacific, New Zealand has launched acompetition to find a flag that represents both its modern,7 multicultural identity and its rich indigenous heritage.It is quite tough to represent an entire nation on apiece of cloth. The Kiwi public has until 16 July, 2015 to10 submit its ideas to an independent panel, made up of prominentNew Zealanders who will help decide what a new flag will looklike. Its task is to choose what it considers to be the best four13 entrants, which will be the subject of a referendum inNovember. There will be a second binding vote early next yearwhen the winner will go up against the current New Zealand16 flag, which features the old colonial British Union Jack on ablue background with four red stars symbolising the SouthernCross constellation.19 Thousands of submissions have been made. Each onewill be considered individually, before this long list is finallywhittled down to the final four. In New Zealand, the most22 common themes in the national flag consideration project arethe silver fern, a plant easily found in New Zealand, and thekiwi, a flightless bird with a long bill. What do our flags say about us? Internet: <www.bbc.com> (adapted). In reference to the vocabulary used in the text What do our flags say about us?, judge the next items.
grupoQuestao.enunciado:
1 How can a country’s history, geography, culture,

politics and religion be squeezed into the design of a flag?

Wars, revolutions, political unions and public competitions

4 have shaped the colours and content of these most evocative of

symbols. In the South Pacific, New Zealand has launched a

competition to find a flag that represents both its modern,

7 multicultural identity and its rich indigenous heritage.

It is quite tough to represent an entire nation on a

piece of cloth. The Kiwi public has until 16 July, 2015 to

10 submit its ideas to an independent panel, made up of prominent

New Zealanders who will help decide what a new flag will look

like. Its task is to choose what it considers to be the best four

13 entrants, which will be the subject of a referendum in

November. There will be a second binding vote early next year

when the winner will go up against the current New Zealand

16 flag, which features the old colonial British Union Jack on a

blue background with four red stars symbolising the Southern

Cross constellation.

19 Thousands of submissions have been made. Each one

will be considered individually, before this long list is finally

whittled down to the final four. In New Zealand, the most

22 common themes in the national flag consideration project are

the silver fern, a plant easily found in New Zealand, and the

kiwi, a flightless bird with a long bill.

What do our flags say about us? Internet: <www.bbc.com> (adapted).

In reference to the vocabulary used in the text What do our flags say about us?, judge the next items.
